column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.There have been no further Covid-19-related deaths recorded in Northern Ireland in the past 24 hours. The total number of deaths remains at 2
column2: 135.Another 82 people have tested positive for coronavirus.There are 68 people in hospitals with Covid-19 - seven of them are in intensive care. Five are being ventilated.The total number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Northern Ireland stands at 118
column4: 826 people in Northern Ireland have received one dose of a Covid-19 vaccine
column7: according to the latest Department of Health figures. The total number of vaccines administered in Northern Ireland is now 1
column9: 743.Last updated 17 April at 14:30 BSTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe Republic of Ireland has recorded one more Covid-19-related deaths
column10: with the total number of deaths now standing at 4
column11: 836.Another 269 people have tested positive with coronavirus.There are 181 people with Covid-19 being treated in Irish hospitals
column12: with 47 receiving intensive care. Last updated 18 April at 17:30 local time.As of 16 April
column15: 354 doses of Covid-19 vaccine had been administered.Of those
column17: 644 people have received their first dose
column19: 710 have also received their second dose.Last updated 18 April at 17:30 local time.Source: Department of Health Ireland
